about.title: Hello there!
about.content:
Hi there, I'm Youenn Pennarun. I am a student in science computing, specialized in application development. Autonomous, Curious and Self-educated, I'm always trying to improve my programming skills
I am also a music lover

professional_experiences.title: Intern as a React native developer
professional_experiences.description:
Development of an Android and IOS application aimed to ease the access to the sharing economy with React Native and Android native modules.
I used Appium and WD.js to create integration tests on Android, Mocha to make unit tests of components, redux's actions and reducers.

I also developed and API with NodeJS and ElasticSearch.

professional_experiences.title: Intern as a fullstack javascript developer
professional_experiences.description:
Development of a customer relationship management application. I also developed the customers area API and a webservice used by a AcommeAssure partner

Creation of an interface allowing the user to easily make automatic tasks. It uses a module based system, each module having its own task(getting data from MongoDB or Elastic, send a mail, export data in csv...). The task is created by stacking modules. For example, search every client who didn't send a document and send a reminder mail to each of them.

Development of data migration scripts

Development of unit tests with Mocha

professional_experiences.title: Internship in web development in ireland
professional_experiences.description: Development of a departmental publications management application in PHP.

projects.name: homyPi
projects.description: This is a personal project still in an early stage. This application aims to be a modulable home automation application on a RaspberryPi. For now, the application can be used as a music player and a connected alarm clock which will play random tracks related to what the user listen to.

projects.name: arduino light switcher
projects.description: This project is my Bachelor Degree project. The project goal was to turn on and off a light remotely with and Arduino card for the hardware and a web server
